articles.author: Reuters Staff
articles.title: CANADA STOCKS-TSX opens higher as energy, mining shares gain - Reuters
articles.description: Canada's main stock index opened higher on Monday, helped by gains in energy and mining stocks, bouncing back from last week's losses that were triggered by a hawkish U.S. Federal Reserve.
articles.content:
By Reuters Staff

articles.title: CANADA STOCKS-TSX opens higher as energy, material stocks gain - Reuters
articles.description: Canada's main stock index rose at open on Friday, driven by gains in energy and gold stocks as underlying commodity prices gained, while more-than-expected jobs were lost in May due to the impact of COVID-19 lockdowns.

articles.title: CANADA STOCKS-TSX opens higher on energy boost - Reuters
articles.description: Canada's main stock index opened higher on Tuesday, as energy stocks gained tracking crude prices, as investors eyed the U.S. Federal Reserve's meeting this week for cues on the tapering of its monetary policy.

articles.author: Jeff Lewis
articles.title: BHP looks to double base metals exploration budget, executive says - Reuters
articles.description: BHP Group plans to almost double exploration spending for base metals within five years, its Chief Technical Officer Laura Tyler said on Wednesday, after shifting its exploration headquarters to Canada.

articles.title: CANADA STOCKS-TSX set for worst day in over 2 weeks as energy stocks weigh - Reuters
articles.description: Canada's main stock index was set to mark its worst day in more than two weeks on Friday, dragged by energy stocks as oil prices dropped for a second straight day on the prospect of interest rate hikes in the United States.
